tips_samples.GT: The tip for improvement is to keep the elbow close to the core to maintain position and bring the hips in, assisting with reaching the next hold.

tips_samples.GT: The participant should focus on memorizing the problem from the ground to climb more fluidly and efficiently, minimizing energy spent looking for holds during the climb.

tips_samples.GT: The participant should work on reducing hesitation during play and manage their fatigue better to ensure they can execute plays effectively.

tips_samples.GT: The participant is encouraged to experiment with changing their sequence, particularly in swapping hand positions to efficiently transition to better holds and improve their climbing technique.

tips_samples.GT: The expert suggests that the climber is performing correctly but needs to focus on successfully holding onto the hold to complete the move.
